titleStmt.title: The nevv art of lying couered by Iesuites vnder the vaile of equiuocation, discouered and disproued by Henry Mason.
titleStmt.author: Mason, Henry, 1573?-1647.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A07210 of text S112437 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 17610). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 274 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 65 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The nevv art of lying couered by Iesuites vnder the vaile of equiuocation, discouered and disproued by Henry Mason.
titleStmt.author: Mason, Henry, 1573?-1647.
Goad, Thomas, 1576-1638.
Featley, Daniel, 1582-1645.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by George Purslowe for Iohn Clarke, and are to be sold at his shop vnder Saint Peters Church in Cornehill,

notesStmt.note: Includes two poems in Latin, one signed by Thomas Goad, the other by Daniel Featley.
The first leaf and the last leaf are blank.
Reproduction of the original in Eton College. Library.
